Thank you for your interest in the Master of Science in Exercise and Wellness (concentration in Healthy Aging) program. I invite you to review a few of our web pages, which are listed below, as you explore this exciting degree.
This page offers general information about the program:
https://chs.asu.edu/snhp/master-science-exercise-wellness-healthy-aging https://webapp4.asu.edu/programs/t5/majorinfo/ASU00/NHEXWHMS/graduate/false
This page answers many frequently asked questions regarding possible deficiency course requirements, application, and student information:
http://healthpromotion.asu.edu/programs/wellness/graduate/faqs/index.htm
Typically students take 2 years (4 semesters) to complete the program. You can estimate the cost of your attendance, based on current tuition/fees: https://students.asu.edu/tuition
There are deficiency courses which can be taken prior to OR during your graduate program:
Undergraduate Course Deficiency BIO 201, 202 Human Anatomy & Physiology NTR 241 Human Nutrition EXW 315 Physiological Foundations of Movement EXW 330 Kinesiological Foundations of Movement EXW 420 Exercise Testing EXW 425 Exercise Prescription
Again, thank you for your interest in the Master of Science in Exercise and Wellness (Healthy Aging) program. Please contact me if you have any additional questions.
Thank you, Kristen Stone, MEd Program Coordinator Sr., Graduate Exercise and Wellness Arizona State University, School of Nutrition and Health Promotion 550 North 3rd Street Phoenix, Arizona 85004 Kristen.J.Stone@asu.edu Phone: 602-496-0862
